prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin of the CAD space. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. This orientation and positioning will be used as the reference for the 2D sketch and subsequent 3D operations. Draw Sketch on Coordinate System Now create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, draw a rectangle defined by two loops: 1. Loop 1: Define a rectangle by drawing 4 lines, in the following order: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.1071, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.1071, 0.0] to [0.1071, 0.2143] - Line 3: [0.1071, 0.2143] to [0.0, 0.2143] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.2143] to [0.0, 0.0] 2. Loop 2: Define a smaller rectangle inside Loop 1 by drawing 4 lines, in the following order: - Line 1: [0.0134, 0.0134] to [0.0938, 0.0134] - Line 2: [0.0938, 0.0134] to [0.0938, 0.2009] - Line 3: [0.0938, 0.2009] to [0.0134, 0.2009] - Line 4: [0.0134, 0.2009] to [0.0134, 0.0134] These two loops form the basis of a stepped rectangle within the sketch. Scale Sketch With the sketch complete, apply the scaling factor of 0.2143 to it. This scaling ensures that the sketched elements fit the intended dimensions for the final part. Transform 2D Sketch into 3D Sketch Now, using the coordinate system created earlier, transform the 2D sketch into 3D. For this transformation, apply a rotation of -90 degrees about the Z-axis and a translation of [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] along the Z-axis. This transformation will position and orient the sketch for 3D operations. Extrude Sketch to Generate 3D Model To form the final 3D model, extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units. This positive extrusion depth will create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The height, width, and length of the prism will be 0.2143 units, 0.75 units, and 2 units, respectively. The prism will be centered on a white background.</description>
